definition: couldn't be better/ideal/wonderful
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

sentences.english: The creation and use of mediation policies is best described by example.
sentences.chinese: 用例子描述中介策略的创建和使用再好不过了。

sentences.english: So much the better, thought I.
Hollywood is the best if you want to come, have a good time, party,
sentences.chinese: 你要想来好好玩，聚会，好莱坞再好不过了。

sentences.english: It'll be just perfect with a little chili oil.
sentences.chinese: 如果再加上一点儿辣椒油就再好不过了。

sentences.english: And if the planet happens to be saved on the way, that is all to the good.
sentences.chinese: 如果在此过程中碰巧拯救了地球，那是再好不过了。

sentences.english: Thers's nothing better than looking at the sea from this place.
sentences.chinese: 在这个位置看大海再好不过了。

sentences.english: But a lark is really the best thing to get up with.
sentences.chinese: 其实跟着云雀起床才是再好不过的。

sentences.english: It is far better to have several players in with you and reduce the gamble.
sentences.chinese: 让几个玩家和你一起玩及减少赌金是再好不过的了。

sentences.english: The weather is all one could wish for today.
Having fire resistant clothing handy for you and for the family can be a good call.
sentences.chinese: 为你和你的家人准备一件防火衣是再好不过的事情了。

sentences.english: Lake in longevity, good health movement.
sentences.chinese: 在长寿湖，养生运动再好不过。

sentences.english: If you can use "less common" vocabulary correctly, that's great.
sentences.chinese: 如果你可以准确地使用不太常见的词汇，那再好不过。

sentences.english: I had expected that writing a book from home would be the best sort of work there was.
sentences.chinese: 我过去以为，呆在家里写书，是再好不过的差事了。

sentences.english: It is far better that they should give us more time.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我们更多的时间，那是再好不过的。

sentences.english: I just wanted to let you know carnell's prepped for surgery.
sentences.chinese: 现在再好不过了我正准备做外科手术说吧什么事？

sentences.english: It would be great if fish really were brain food.
sentences.chinese: 若是吃鱼真有助于提升智力，那么再好不过了。

definition: one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
fabulous/superb/excellent
lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
exceptionally good
to treat differently/another cup of tea
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
to be nothing difficult/to be a cinch
needless to say/it goes without saying
enough and to spare (idiom)
sensible act
hard to come by/rare
What can you have against it? (idiom)/We should do this./Go for it!
a fine thing/a wonderful thing
no harm (in doing it)/One might as well./It won't hurt./no matter/it's no bother
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
easy/with no difficulty
